newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas called flat to lower, cash holds.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas called flat to lower, cash holds.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas futures were expected to open unchanged to lower Tuesday, mirroring June's performance on ACCESS, industry sources said.
June over-the-counter trade ranged from $2.20 to $2.22 after settling Monday at $2.22 per million British thermal units.
On ACCESS, June last traded one cent lower at $2.21.
Meanwhile, early cash prices at the Henry Hub, La., were talked steady at $2.19-2.22 per mmBtu.
Chart traders pegged resistance in June at $2.33 and then at the $2.385 contract high. Support was seen at $2.17, then at $2.05 and along the up trendline at $2.03.

In Monday's cash market, Gulf Coast prices firmed a couple of cents to near $2.20. Midcon pipes were steady to down slightly around $2. New York city gate gas was slightly firmer in the mid-to-high $2.40s.
Forecasts for this week are calling for slightly below-normal temperatures in the Northeast and upper Midwest and six to 12 degrees above normal in the Southwest.
Early estimates for Wednesday's American Gas Association storage report are about 30 bcf of injections, versus a gain of 53 bcf a year ago.
